Key Match Events: Jake Bauers made an incredible diving play to end the game on what would have otherwise been a walk-off hit for Ty France.
Noelvi Marte had a home run robbed from him by Blake Perkins.
Willy Adames hit a 3-run home run in the top of the 3rd inning.
Amed Rosario hit a 2-run home run in the bottom of the 6th inning.
Jackson Chourio hit a 1-out solo home run in the top of the 9th inning.
Post-Match Reflections: The Reds still haven't had a hit against Devin Williams since Alejo Lopez had an infield single back on September 11th of 2022.
The Reds lead all of baseball in runners thrown out on the basepaths.
The Reds have not won a series against the Milwaukee Brewers this season.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Brewers went 1-15 with runners in scoring position.
The Reds went 1-10 with runners in scoring position.
The game was a part of a series between the Cincinnati Reds and the Milwaukee Brewers.
Others: The Reds' manager, David Bell, was questioned for his in-game decisions and his handling of the team.
The Reds' front office, led by GM Nick Krall, was criticized for their lack of action at the trade deadline.
The Reds' ownership, led by Bob Castellini, was mentioned as a potential reason for the team's struggles.
